content:
It sounds like you have a well-rounded training program that incorporates a variety of exercises and activities to improve your running performance. Tempo running twice a week is an excellent way to build endurance and speed, and swimming can help improve your overall cardiovascular fitness while also providing a low-impact workout for your joints.

In addition to your cardio activities, your resistance training program is also well-designed to support your running goals. The explosive exercise you mentioned can help improve your power and speed, while the hypertrophy-focused exercises can help build up your muscular endurance and strength.

To reach your goal of a 20-minute 5k, you may want to consider incorporating interval training into your running routine. Interval training involves alternating between periods of high-intensity running and recovery periods of lower intensity. This type of training can be particularly effective for improving speed and endurance and may help you achieve your goal time.

Additionally, paying attention to your nutrition and recovery habits can also help support your running performance. Be sure to fuel your body with a balanced diet that includes plenty of protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Adequate rest and recovery time is also essential to allow your muscles to repair and grow stronger.

Overall, it sounds like you are on the right track to reaching your running goals. With consistent training and attention to your overall fitness and health, you can continue to improve your performance and reach your desired 5k time.
